Line 67: Line 67:
The basic salaries at Google were, before the IPO, considered to be quite low compared to industry standards. For instance, some [[system administrator]]s earned no more than $33,000–37,000: is considered to be low by [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] standard levels, but excellent stock performance has left these early employees well compensated. In recent times, Google has implemented other incentives such as the [http://blog.monkeymethods.org/2005/02/google-founders-awards-is-good-idea-tm.html Founder's award], as well as offering higher salaries to new employees.
The basic salaries at Google were, before the IPO, considered to be quite low compared to industry standards. For instance, some [[system administrator]]s earned no more than $33,000–37,000: is considered to be low by [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] standard levels, but excellent stock performance has left these early employees well compensated. In recent times, Google has implemented other incentives such as the [http://blog.monkeymethods.org/2005/02/google-founders-awards-is-good-idea-tm.html Founder's award], as well as offering higher salaries to new employees.
â
Beyond monetary compensation, Google's workplace amenities, culture, global popularity and stellar prospects (relative to most Bay Area companies), and strong brand continue to attract far more applicants than there are positions available. As a result, Google reportedly had to hire one in-house legal recruiter just to help the legal department sort through resumes from job-hungry [[lawyer]]s.
+
Beyond monetary compensation, Google's workplace amenities, culture, global popularity , stellar prospects (relative to most Bay Area companies), and strong brand continue to attract far more applicants than there are positions available. As a result, Google reportedly had to hire one in-house legal recruiter just to help the legal department sort through resumes from job-hungry [[lawyer]]s.
